intro: Thelaia media, commonly known as the common thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Thelaia media typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its robust growth and hardy nature make it a common sight in various habitats across its native range.
